meanings.sent1: She reinvoked the memories of her childhood through old photographs.
meanings.sent2: The wizard reinvoked the ancient spell to protect the village.
meanings.sent3: The teacher reinvoked the students' interest in the subject with a fun experiment.
meanings.sent4: The melody reinvoked feelings of nostalgia in the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies reinvoked memories of baking with her grandmother.

meanings.sent1: He reinvoked the ancient spirits during the ritual.
meanings.sent2: The hero reinvoked his courage to face the dragon.
meanings.sent3: The chef reinvoked the delicious aroma of the dish by adding more spices.
meanings.sent4: The artist reinvoked the forgotten beauty of the landscape in his painting.
meanings.sent5: The storyteller reinvoked the magic of the tale with vivid descriptions.

meanings.definition: Bring back into use or existence
meanings.sent1: The town council reinvoked an old law to address the issue.
meanings.sent2: The company reinvoked an ancient tradition to boost employee morale.
meanings.sent3: The gardener reinvoked the neglected garden by planting colorful flowers.
meanings.sent4: The renovation reinvoked the grandeur of the historic building.
meanings.sent5: The recipe reinvoked the flavors of a bygone era.
